feed.title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
feed.subtitle: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

entry.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle reflected XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
In Moodle before 3.9.1, 3.8.4 and 3.7.7, the filter in the admin task log required extra sanitizing to prevent a reflected XSS risk.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-14320
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=407392
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/c6ffe9588ebb02b73c33a09e5d8061f58acc1701
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-fcpw-vqh5-6qwj

entry.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
In Moodle 3.8, messages required extra sanitizing before updating the conversation overview, to prevent the risk of stored cross-site scripting.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-1691
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=395953
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/4e809346537e230cbff8235bfee0e7e151e4e9f9
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-cwhp-rqfr-8462

entry.title: [froala/wysiwyg-editor] Froala WYSIWYG Editor XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
Froala Editor before 3.2.2 allows XSS via pasted content.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-26523
  • https://froala.com/wysiwyg-editor/changelog/
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-qrhq-x7xh-2784

entry.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
Magento versions 2.4.0 and 2.3.5p1 (and earlier) are affected by a persistent XSS vulnerability that allows users to upload malicious JavaScript via the file upload component. This vulnerability could be abused by an unauthenticated attacker to execute XSS attacks against other Magento users. This vulnerability requires a victim to browse to the uploaded file.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-24408
  • https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/magento/apsb20-59.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-jxjc-6xmh-h7mg

entry.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle incorrect access control
entry.content:
A vulnerability was found in Moodle where users with "Log in as" capability in a course context (typically, course managers) may gain access to some site administration capabilities by "logging in as" a System manager. This affects 3.9 to 3.9.1, 3.8 to 3.8.4, 3.7 to 3.7.7, 3.5 to 3.5.13 and earlier unsupported versions. This is fixed in 3.9.2, 3.8.5, 3.7.8 and 3.5.14.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-25629
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=410841
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-f5r8-7h4f-jr9x

entry.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition RCE via Unsafe File Upload
entry.content:
Magento versions 2.4.0 and 2.3.5p1 (and earlier) are affected by an unsafe file upload vulnerability that could result in arbitrary code execution. This vulnerability could be abused by authenticated users with administrative permissions to the System/Data and Transfer/Import components.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-24407
  • https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/magento/apsb20-59.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-7pxg-6p87-8c9v

entry.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition Incorrect Authorization
entry.content:
Magento versions 2.4.0 and 2.3.5p1 (and earlier) are affected by an incorrect authorization vulnerability. A user can still access resources provisioned under their old role after an administrator removes the role or disables the user's account.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-24401
  • https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/magento/apsb20-59.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-f2g3-3c6q-4478

entry.title: [microweber/microweber] Microweber Insufficient Session Expiry
entry.content:
Microweber v1.1.18 is affected by no session expiry after log-out.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-23136
  • https://gist.github.com/virendratiwari03/0b0d161e1141fdd74122abbb02fefe17
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-g7r3-jwhw-2wfv

entry.title: [microweber/microweber] Microweber Discloses Sensitive Information
entry.content:
userfiles/modules/users/controller/controller.php in Microweber before 1.1.20 allows an unauthenticated user to disclose the users database via a /modules/ POST request.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-13405
  • https://github.com/microweber/microweber/commit/269320e0e0e06a1785e1a1556da769a34280b7e6
  • https://rhinosecuritylabs.com/research/microweber-database-disclosure/
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-pmxg-w9c7-ffmq

entry.title: [silverstripe/cms] Silverstripe CMS XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
In SilverStripe through 4.5, malicious users with a valid Silverstripe CMS login (usually CMS access) can craft profile information which can lead to XSS for other users through specially crafted login form URLs.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-9311
  • https://www.silverstripe.org/download/security-releases/CVE-2020-9311
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-2pw2-qpcp-m47x

entry.title: [silverstripe/cms] Silverstripe CMS information disclosure
entry.content:
In SilverStripe through 4.5.0, a specific URL path configured by default through the silverstripe/framework module can be used to disclose the fact that a domain is hosting a Silverstripe application. There is no disclosure of the specific version. The functionality on this URL path is limited to execution in a CLI context, and is not known to present a vulnerability through web-based access. As a side-effect, this preconfigured path also blocks the creation of other resources on this path (e.g. a page).

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-6164
  • https://www.silverstripe.org/download/security-releases/CVE-2020-6164
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-gm5x-hpmw-xpxg

entry.title: [silverstripe/cms] Silverstripe CMS malicious file upload enables script execution
entry.content:
Silverstripe CMS through 4.5 can be susceptible to script execution from malicious upload contents under allowed file extensions (for example HTML code in a TXT file). When these files are stored as protected or draft files, the MIME detection can cause browsers to execute the file contents. Uploads stored as protected or draft files are allowed by default for authorised users only, but can also be enabled through custom logic as well as modules such as silverstripe/userforms. Sites using the previously optional silverstripe/mimevalidator module can configure MIME whitelists rather than extension whitelists, and hence prevent this issue. Sites on the Common Web Platform (CWP) use this module by default, and are not affected.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-9309
  • https://www.silverstripe.org/download/security-releases/CVE-2020-9309
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-h77w-655f-6j3m

entry.title: [shopware/platform] Shopware vulnerable to SSRF
entry.content:
Shopware before 6.2.3 is vulnerable to a Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) in its "Mediabrowser upload by URL" feature. This allows an authenticated user to send HTTP, HTTPS, FTP, and SFTP requests on behalf of the Shopware platform server.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-13970
  • https://docs.shopware.com/en/shopware-6-en/security-updates/security-update-07-2020
  • https://www.shopware.com/en/changelog/#6-2-3
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-5vmg-x99g-396q

entry.title: [dolibarr/dolibarr] Dolibarr CRM allows Privilege Escalation
entry.content:
Dolibarr CRM before 11.0.5 allows privilege escalation. This could allow remote authenticated attackers to upload arbitrary files via societe/document.php in which "disabled" is changed to "enabled" in the HTML source code.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-14201
  • https://www.wizlynxgroup.com/security-research-advisories/vuln/WLX-2020-011
  • https://github.com/Dolibarr/dolibarr/blob/e76641c491e4105e9cb1ded6149771c621d822b5/ChangeLog#L2933
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-25h3-mw3p-w8r7

entry.title: [impresscms/impresscms] ImpressCMS Cross-site Scripting vulnerability
entry.content:
A cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in ImpressCMS v1.4.5 and before allows attackers to execute arbitrary web scripts or HTML via a crafted payload injected into the smile_code parameter of the component /editprofile.php.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-37785
  • https://github.com/CrownZTX/cve-description
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-667r-p4gg-7m2q
